responses: Visitors from certain countries do not require a visa for stays up to 90 days. Other visitors will need to obtain a visa before arriving in Morocco. Please check with your local Moroccan embassy or consulate for more information You can apply for a visa through the Moroccan embassy or consulate in your country. The application process can take several weeks, so it's important to plan ahead , The type of visa you need will depend on the purpose of your visit, the length of your stay, and your nationality. Please consult with your local Moroccan embassy or consulate for more information.

internal:
- Taxis are a convenient and relatively cheap mode of transportation in Marrakech. Be sure to negotiate the price with the driver before getting in to avoid any misunderstandings. 
 - Marrakech has a comprehensive public bus network that covers most of the city's major areas. Bus fares are low, making it a good option for those on a tight budget. 
 - Horse-drawn carriages, known as caleches, are a popular way to explore Marrakech's main tourist areas. 
 - Bicycles can be rented from various locations around the city, but cyclists should exercise caution due to Marrakech's chaotic traffic. 
 - Many of Marrakech's famous attractions are within walking distance of each other, but be prepared for the heat in the summer months.
external:
There are several ways to get transported from Marrakech to other cities in Morocco. Here are some options: 
 - By bus: There are several bus companies that operate services from Marrakech to other cities.You can book your ticket online or buy it from the bus station. 
 - By train: The national railway company ONCF operates trains from Marrakech to several cities in Morocco. The train station is located in the city center, and you can buy your ticket online or at the station. 
 - By taxi: You can hire a taxi to take you to other cities. You can either negotiate a price with the driver or use a shared taxi service, which is cheaper but may take longer as it waits for other passengers. 
 - By car: You can rent a car and drive to other cities. This gives you the freedom to stop at places along the way and explore different parts of Morocco. 
 - By air: Marrakech has an international airport with flights to several cities in Morocco and other countries. This is the fastest way to get to other cities.

responses:
The French only need a valid passport to enter the kingdom. However, this stay cannot exceed 90 days 
To move to Morocco, there are two types of residence permits depending on the duration of your expatriation:
- The registration card: this is valid for one to ten years as long as you do not leave the territory for more than six months during this period. Once the validity period expires, you must have a residence card or a renewal to stay in the country.
- The residence card: to obtain this residence permit, it is essential to justify a four-year and uninterrupted residence in Morocco. The card is issued for ten years and can be renewed. This option is therefore aimed at people who wish to settle in Morocco permanently.
Note that it is mandatory to have a valid residence permit to carry out certain administrative procedures (opening a bank account, consular card, etc.).
Good to know: children under 16 are not affected by registration.

hotels: The average price of hotels in Marrakech can vary depending on the time of year, the location, and the type of accommodation. However the average price range for a mid-range hotel in Marrakech is around $50 to $100 per night, while luxury hotels could range from $150 to $500 per night and it's for more details visit the hotels section of our website
restaurants:
The average price of a meal in a restaurant in Marrakech can vary depending on the type of restaurant and location. In general, you can expect to pay around 100-200 Moroccan Dirhams (roughly 10-20 USD) for a basic meal at a local restaurant or cafe.
 If you are dining at a higher-end restaurant or a touristy area, the price can be significantly higher, and you can expect to pay around 300-500 Moroccan Dirhams (roughly 30-50 USD) or more for a meal.
 It's worth noting that many restaurants in Marrakech also offer set menus or prix-fixe menus, which can be a more cost-effective way to enjoy a meal. Additionally, street food stalls and markets offer delicious and affordable food options for budget travelers
transportation:
The average transportation price in Marrakech, Morocco varies depending on the mode of transportation you choose. Here are some estimated prices for common transportation options in Marrakech: 
 - Taxi: Taxis are a common mode of transportation in Marrakech. The starting fare is around 2.50 MAD (Moroccan Dirham), and then the fare increases by 1.60 MAD per kilometer traveled. For example, a 5-kilometer ride would cost around 10.50 MAD.
 - Bus: The cost of a bus ride in Marrakech is around 4 MAD per person. However, keep in mind that buses can be crowded and may not always run on schedule.
 - Horse-drawn carriage: A popular tourist attraction in Marrakech is a ride on a horse-drawn carriage, known as a 'caleche.' Prices vary, but expect to pay around 150-200 MAD for a 45-minute ride.
 - Bicycle: If you prefer to explore Marrakech on two wheels, you can rent a bicycle for around 50-100 MAD per day.
 Keep in mind that prices can vary depending on the time of day and the season. It's always a good idea to negotiate prices in advance, especially with taxi drivers and horse-drawn carriage operators.
flights: The average price to fly to Morocco can vary depending on the time of year, the departure city, and the airline you choose. As chatbot assistance, I don't have access to real-time data, it's always best to check with various airlines and travel booking websites to get the most accurate and up-to-date prices for your desired travel dates
guided tours:
The average price of a guided tour in Morocco can vary depending on the type of tour and the level of luxury. For example, a basic city tour can cost around 200-300 Moroccan Dirhams (MAD), while a more specialized tour, such as a guided visit to a palace or a historical site, may cost around 500-700 MAD.
 If you're interested in outdoor activities, such as trekking or a desert tour, prices can range from 1,000 to 3,000 MAD, depending on the duration and the level of comfort.

responses:
The weather in Marrakech is typically hot and dry, with an average temperature of 22°C (72°F) in the winter and 30°C (86°F) in the summer. The city is located in a desert climate zone, which means that it receives very little rainfall throughout the year. The average annual rainfall in Marrakech is only 2-3 inches (5-8 cm).

The best time to visit Marrakech is between October and April, when the weather is pleasant and the city is less crowded. However, if you're interested in visiting during the summer, the best time to visit is between June and September, when the weather is cooler and the city is less crowded.

responses: The Official currency of Morocco is the Moroccan Dirham (MAD). The Dirham is divided into 100 centimes. The Dirham is available in denominations of 10, 20, 50, 100 and 200 Dirhams. Coins are available in denominations of 1, 5, 10, 20 and 50 centimes, as well as 1, 2, 5 and 10 Dirhams. The Dirham is a closed currency, which means it can only be traded within Morocco. It is recommended to exchange currency at a bank or official exchange office. It is also recommended to keep receipts when exchanging currency, as they may be required when exchanging back to your home currency. It is also recommended to keep small bills on hand, as it is common for vendors to not have change for larger bills. Additionally, it is important to keep in mind that many vendors do not accept credit cards, so it is best to have cash on hand.
